text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 0_Siman: Anyone that does not have any money, other than 5 selahs, must use them for himself over his son.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 39_Siman: Rav Acha said to those gathered there the day after:
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 18_Siman: The Beraisa taught: to teach him  Torah.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 26_Siman: A woman does not have to learn Torah because no one has to teach her.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 22_Siman: How do I know the mother is not obligated to teach Torah?...
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 19_Siman: From where do we know this?
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 21_Siman: If someone was not taught by his father, he should teach himself, as the Pasuk says: and you should learn.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 20_Siman: That it says in the Pasuk: That you should teach your sons.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 24_Siman: How do I know that she doesn't have an obligation to teach torah to herself?
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 29_Siman: If he can learn OR his son, he comes before his son. Rabbi Yehuda says:
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 27_Siman: And where do we know this? Because it says in the Pasuk your sons, and not your daughters.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 25_Siman: Since the word “you shall teach” can also be written “you shall learn”: those whom others are required to teach are required to teach themselves; those whom others are not required to teach are not required to teach themselves.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 23_Siman: Since the word “you shall teach” can also be written “you shall learn”: those who are required to learn torah are required to teach torah; those who are not required to learn are not required to teach.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 40_Siman: Had there not been a miracle here, I would have been in great danger.
text.0_Perek, 40_Halacha, 30_Siman: If your son is an interested person, smart, and has a good memory, then your son comes before you.
